node.title: 29 World Cup games to be played in New Zealand
node.description: Football fans around the country will get 29 opportunities to see the best players in the game on show during the 2023 Women's World Cup.

node.title: Unvaccinated private boat owners a risk to Aotea's community - iwi
node.description: Locals on Aotea Great Barrier Island are worried about the impact holiday travellers will have on the community when the country moves into the traffic light system tomorrow.

node.title: What happened to the perfect child?
node.description: More than 20 years ago, a Russian girl was adopted by a young American couple who eventually brought her back to Moscow after her parents say she tried to kill her baby brother.

node.title: Ocean plastic pollution is being colonized by coastal species
node.description: Researchers still have questions about these new plastic-living communities, but the discovery could change ocean ecosystems on a global scale.

node.title: Second U.S. case of Omicron spotted in Minnesota, after NYC travel
node.description: The Minnesota man attended a convention where organizers had apologized to 53,000 attendees for long lines.

node.title: An ad with a vaccinated Santa that drew 5,000 complaints is cleared by British regulators.
node.description: The commercial, for the supermarket chain Tesco, depicted Santa Claus being cleared to travel.

node.title: On the Market in New York City
node.description: This week’s properties are in Dumbo, Chelsea and on the Upper West Side.

node.title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
node.description: This week’s homes are a five-bedroom homes in Oyster Bay Cove, N.Y., and Cherry Hill, N.J.

node.title: Lloyd Austin Says China Increasing Tensions in Asia by Testing Hypersonic Weapons
node.description: The U.S. defense secretary said he was concerned about China's testing of the weapons.

node.title: In Wake of Oxford School Shooting, Parkland Survivor Opens Up About His Regrets
node.description: Cameron Kasky reflected on the key role he's taken on in the youth-led movement on gun violence prevention, writing "I wish I could have done it all right."

node.title: Videos Found on Ethan Crumbley's Phone 'Horrendously Disturbing,' Oakland Co. Sheriff Says
node.description: During Crumbley's arraignment police said they found a journal in his backpack "detailing his desire to shoot up a school to include murdering students."

node.title: Migrants in Detention Centers Have Increased More Rhan 55 Percent Since Biden Took Office
node.description: About 77 percent of those in detention were arrested by U.S. Customs and Border Protection while 23 percent were apprehended by ICE, according to Syracuse University's TRAC.

node.title: Willis promises to be balancing force as National's new deputy leader
node.description: National's new deputy leader Nicola Willis says she brings a centrist, moderate perspective of a parent of four, along with a familiarity with Parliament that balances out the new leader.

node.title: Culture of reading among children improves mental wellbeing - research
node.description: Studies have shown children's enjoyment of reading is related to a longer life, better mental wellbeing and healthier eating. Fiction reading is related to better performance at school.

node.title: Germany announces lockdown on unvaccinated amid COVID surge
node.description: "The situation is our country is serious," said German Chancellor Angela Merkel, calling the measure an "act of national solidarity."

node.title: Layoffs around the U.S. fall to lowest level since 1993
node.description: Announced job cuts are at a three-decade low, while new claims for jobless aid are down to pre-pandemic levels.

node.title: BuzzFeed News’s union workers walk off the job for a day.
node.description: The employees walked out on an important day for the media company: Shareholders are voting Thursday to take it public.

node.title: United Auto Workers reformers prevail in vote to choose president by direct election.
node.description: Supporters of the change say it would curb corruption. A referendum on the question was required in a consent decree between the union and prosecutors.

node.title: Mexico to Allow U.S. ‘Remain in Mexico’ Asylum Policy to Resume
node.description: A judge had ordered the Biden administration to restart the Trump-era program, but doing so required cooperation from Mexico, which had been reluctant until now.

node.title: Former Ohio Deputy Is Indicted in Fatal Shooting of Columbus Man
node.description: The former deputy, Jason Meade, was a member of a fugitive task force when he shot Casey Goodson Jr., 23, who was not the target of the operation, according to the indictment. He faces two murder counts.

node.title: Scientists say they may have found the way AstraZeneca’s vaccine can cause rare blood clots.
node.description: The findings suggest that the problem is linked to the shot’s use of another, harmless virus to deliver information into human cells.

node.title: New Binary Star Type Discovered is The 'Missing Link' In Stellar Evolution
node.description: The discovery could finally explain how a type of stellar remnant called extremely low mass white dwarfs form, something that has puzzled scientists for decades.

node.title: Male Caimans Sing to Females for Love
node.description: The caiman courtship strategy was filmed for the Discovery+ series "The Mating Game."

node.title: Omicron COVID Variant Outbreak at Christmas Party Infects 60 People
node.description: If confirmed, the infections that followed an event in Oslo could be the biggest single outbreak recorded of the new COVID variant.

node.title: South Korea Has Record Number of COVID Patients Deemed Serious or Critical
node.description: In South Korea, there are 733 patients who are deemed to be in serious or critical condition and the COVID-19 ICU's are at 90 percent capacity.

node.title: Israel to Use Phones to Track Individuals Confirmed to Have Omicron Variant
node.description: Israel had been using the technology on and off since March 2020 to curb the spread of the pandemic, but civil rights groups blasted the measure.

node.title: Germany Bans Unvaccinated From Nonessential Stores, Could Enact National Mandate
node.description: "The situation in our country is serious," said outgoing German Chancellor Angela Merkel during a press conference.

node.title: Man Who Attended NYC Anime Convention Becomes Minnesota's First Omicron Case
node.description: Officials worry the Omicron variant is more transmissible and could potentially reduce the effectiveness of vaccines and therapeutics.

node.title: Ohio Deputy Charged a Year After Fatally Shooting Casey Goodson Jr. in Front of Children
node.description: Franklin County Sheriff's Deputy Jason Meade was indicted Thursday on two charges of murder and one count of reckless homicide in the fatal shooting of Casey Goodson, Jr.

node.title: U.S. and China Top Military Officials Set to Meet Over Increasing Arms Race
node.description: Hong Kong's South China Morning Post reported that talks were agreed on during last month's highly watched summit between Joe Biden and Xi Jinping.
